cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 25 mi E of Wilmington North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest toward the southeastern North Carolina coast near Wilmington, then forecast to drift slowly west-southwest into eastern South Carolina before turning north across the western Carolinas and central Appalachians early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Wilmington, North Carolina (Cape Fear area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Duck NC, including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern and central North Carolina and northeastern South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds up to 90 mph with higher gusts are likely at the port as the eye crosses the coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge inundation of 4–6 ft above ground level is possible in the Cape Fear River and Wilmington waterfront, accompanied by large destructive waves.
weather_observation.rainfall: Catastrophic rainfall totals of 20–25 inches with isolated 30–40 inches expected, producing flash and prolonged river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents; prolonged river and inland flooding could disrupt ground transport and port access.
